{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = People use the word exponentially to just mean something is growing rapidly, like in the colloquial sense, but it does have an actual meaning that Alex definitely doesn't know.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:46.240
    | text      = It means that growth is characterized by this multiplication, not by doubling.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:51.240
    | text      = At the first interval, it's just the base growth rate.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = At the second, it's that rate squared.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:56.240

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:59.240
    | text      = Typically, in the early stages of viruses spreading, they do sometimes tend to show exponential growth until there's a countervailing force against it, like a vaccine or some sort of an intervention method.
